                                 Release Notes
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Berber Kingdom of Morocco 

It is easy to think of Islamic North Africa as Arab rather than African, but the 
land that is now Morocco once lay at the centre of a vast African kingdom that 
stretched from northern Spain to the heart of West Africa. It was created by 
African Berbers and ruled for centuries by two dynasties that created tremendous 
wealth, commissioned fabulous architecture and promoted sophisticated ideas. But 
Dr Casely-Hayford reveals how the very forces that forged the kingdom ultimately 
helped to destroy its indigenous African identity.



Director: Ian Lilley
Stars: Gus Casely-Hayford
